docs.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration today ordered sharp restrictions on the use of silicone gel breast implants while extensive studies of their safety are carried out. Women who want the implants after cancer surgery will be able to get them, but only a few thousand women will be allowed to use them simply to enlarge their breasts. All women who receive the implants must agree to take part in clinical studies.

headline.main: F.D.A. Restricts Use of Implants Pending Studies
